title: Russ Crane (American football)
text:
Russell J. Crane (1906/1907 - March 18, 1966) was an American <a href="college%20football">college football</a> player and coach and <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. He was a prominent <a href="Guard%20%28American%20football%29">guard</a> for coach <a href="Robert%20Zuppke">Robert Zuppke</a>'s <a href="Illinois%20Fighting%20Illini%20football">Illinois Fighting Illini</a>, <a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a> in <a href="1929%20Illinois%20Fighting%20Illini%20football%20team">1929</a>.
Crane was an assistant football coach at the <a href="University%20of%20Richmond">University of Richmond</a> from 1935 to 1938. He turned to Richmond as line coach and head <a href="track%20and%20field">track</a> coach in 1946.
He died of <a href="pulmonary%20heart%20disease">pulmonary heart disease</a> in <a href="Monongalia%20County%2C%20West%20Virginia">Monongalia County, West Virginia</a>, on March 18, 1966, at age 59.
